[[File:DickseeRomeoandJuliet.jpg|right|250px|thumb|upright|Archetypal lovers [[Romeo and Juliet]] portrayed by [[Frank Bernard Dicksee|Frank Dicksee]]]]
 
'''Love''' is the [[emotion]] of strong [[affection]] and personal [[attachment (psychology)|attachment]].<ref name="oxford">''Oxford Illustrated American Dictionary'' (1998) + ''Merriam-Webster Collegiate Dictionary'' (2000)</ref> In philosophical context, love is a [[virtue]] representing all of human [[kindness]], [[compassion]], and [[affection]]. In some [[religious]] contexts, love is not just a virtue, but the basis for all ''[[being]]'', as in the Christian phrase, "[[God is love]]" (See also [[Agape]] and the [[Canonical gospels]])<ref>[[Deus Caritas Est]], Roman Catholic encyclical by Pope Benedict XVI</ref>. Love may also be described as actions towards others (or oneself) based on compassion.<ref>Fromm, Eric; "The Art of Loving", Harper Perennial (1956), Original English Version, ISBN-10: 0060958286 ISBN-13: 978-0060958282</ref> Or as actions towards others based on affection.<ref>Fromm, Eric; "The Art of Loving", Harper Perennial (1956), Original English Version, ISBN-10: 0060958286 ISBN-13: 978-0060958282</ref>
 
'''Love''' is the [[emotion]] of strong [[affection]] and personal [[attachment (psychology)|attachment]].<ref name="oxford">''Oxford Illustrated American Dictionary'' (1998) + ''Merriam-Webster Collegiate Dictionary'' (2000)</ref> In philosophical context, love is a [[virtue]] representing all of human [[kindness]], [[compassion]], and [[affection]]. In some [[religious]] contexts, love is not just a virtue, but the basis for all ''[[being]]'', as in the Christian phrase, "[[God is love]]" (See also [[Agape]] and the [[Canonical gospels]])<ref>[[Deus Caritas Est]], Roman Catholic encyclical by Pope Benedict XVI</ref>. Love may also be described as actions towards others (or oneself) based on compassion.<ref>Fromm, Eric; "The Art of Loving", Harper Perennial (1956), Original English Version, ISBN-10: 0060958286 ISBN-13: 978-0060958282</ref> Or as actions towards others based on affection.<ref>Fromm, Eric; "The Art of Loving", Harper Perennial (1956), Original English Version, ISBN-10: 0060958286 ISBN-13: 978-0060958282</ref>
